Hi,
   I was able to take that Howard soot mechanism and carry out the
foll=
owing steps within matlab (linux):

Ck2cti('rxnfile.txt', 'thermofile.txt')=


Largemech =3D importPhase('rxnfile.cti') 

It did import successfully. Un=
fortunately, I don't have a matlab license
on the pc, so I can't check your=
 exact error configuration. The setup I
used was:

Linux redhat, 64 bit (ha=
d to create my own 64 bit python as the system
python is 32 bit)
Gcc 3.4.3
=
Matlab 7.4.0
Cantera's current cvs distribution

I did notice a few errors.=
 There was an error in the 'make install'
command for matlab that I will fi=
x asap ( a file was left out of the
installation).

The ck2cti() matlab com=
mand also didn't produce any meaningful error
messages in ck2cti.log, when =
I gave it the wrong input commands. I will
try to add more informative erro=
r messages.

Best wishes,
Harry Moffat

Hi!
I am using cantera in MATLAB to calc=
ulate kinetics. I've already made
some experiences in converting CK-Mechani=
sms with ck2cti and importing
them with importphase.
As I wantet to create =
an own mechanism combining those for isooctane and
nheptane (from LLNI) and=
 for Toluene (from Massachusetts Institute of
Technology Department of Chem=
ical Engineering,
http://web.mit.edu/anish/www/MITcomb.html).
After removin=
g those reactions, which where identified by ck2ctml to be
undefined duplic=
ated I tried to load the mechanism using importphase.
There have been some =
more reactions with 'M' or in different order,
which still have been undefi=
ned duplicated. I commented them, too.

Now MATLAB seems to hang up, becaus=
e there aren't any error messages,
but nothing happens when I'm trying to i=
mport the Phase:

ck2cti('prf_2d_mech.txt','prf_2d_therm.txt') % works
gas=
=3DimportPhase('prf_2d_mech.cti'); % PC hangs up :-(

Do you have any sugge=
stions to fix the problem??? Thanks a lot.

By the way: 
Is it able to disa=
be the warnings for incontinuities of thermodynamic
properties at the middl=
e of the temperatur-interval.
And:
Do you know any links for more mechanism=
s concerning petrol combustion.

Thank you very much



 
Yahoo! Groups Lin=
ks
